msIdentifier.repository: Topkapı Palace Museum (Topkapı Sarayı Müzesi) , Istanbul

summary.p: 522 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: E. H. 7; Complete text of the Qur'an; 15 lines per page; Dimensions: 225 x 195 mm; Script style: kūfī; Estimated date of production: 3rd (9th) century [according to Karatay].

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 16: "43 E. H. 7 Aynı Parşömen. 195mm boy ve 225mm eninde cönk biçiminde 522 yaprak. Sahifede kûfî yazı ile 180mm uzunl.[uğunda] 15 satır. Tahmine göre Mısır’da III. asırda kopya edilmiştir. Baştan üç sahifede Mısır üslûbunda hendesî ve geçme şekillerle yaldızlı levha vardır. Sure başları ayni tarzda yaldızladır. Y. 98 in dörtte üçü yırtılmış ve kağıtla tamir edilmiştir. Miklepli ve şemseli siyah deri Osmanlı cildi."

This can be translated as follows: "43 E. H. 7 Same Parchment. 522 junk shaped leaves of 195 mm height and 225 mm width. The text area written in Kufic script [contains] 15 lines measuring 180 mm. Probably copied in Egypt during the 3rd [(9th)] century. On the first three leaves, there is a gilded plate in Egyptian style with geometric and interlaced forms. Sūra beginnings are gilded in the same style. Three quarters of L. 98 is torn and repaired with paper. Black leather Ottoman binding with flap (miklep) and mandorla (şemse)."
